info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 6 at 12:35AM PDT until September 6 at 3:45AM PDT by NWS Las Vegas NV
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southern Nevada, including the following county, Clark.
* WHEN...Until 345 AM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1235 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Las Vegas, North Las Vegas, Fremont Street, Nellis AFB, Aliante, East Las Vegas, The Strip, The Motor Speedway, Paradise, Lone Mountain, Centennial Hills, Spring Valley, Summerlin, Red Rock Canyon, North Las Vegas Airport, Las Vegas Ballpark, Red Rock Canyon Campground, Rocky Gap Campground, Stratosphere Tower and Frenchman Mtn. - This includes Interstate 15 in Nevada near mile marker 60. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
